Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today the 12th of February 2026 in the KT16 postcode area. Our contractors Avidety have advised that unfortunately there is going to be a delay in restoring your power. This is due to safety issues with equipment failure which delayed the works from being started safely. We now estimate to restore your power between approximately 20:30-21:30. We will be pro-actively attempting to contact you to see if additional support is required. We have a customer support vehicle which is in the entrance of Elm Farm Caravan Park so please feel free to visit for further support on site. Our reference number for this work is INCD-99044-V. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the KT16 postcode area, then please call 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are removing overhead electricity cables and replacing them with new underground electricity cables. Whilst carrying out this work we will be replacing a piece of equipment called a transformer. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To connect the new cables and replace the transformer safely, we need to turn your power off. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place on Lyne Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A customer has asked UK Power Networks to switch off the power so they can safely cut back trees in the area that have grown close to overhead electricity cables. These trees could cause damage to the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so a tree surgeon can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future, as we appreciate that you may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts. This work is taking place on Highwood Road.

Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Sand Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on Lower Green.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine two transformers on our electricity poles to check they are functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted by unplanned power cuts. This work is taking place in two locations, one off Mockbeggar Lane and one off Tenterden Road.

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 13th February 2026 in the TN11 postcode area. The power was switched off to enable our engineers to carry out alterations to an overhead service following a customer request and also to change a transformer near Vauxhall Lane. Our engineers have advised us that the 32 affected properties will be restored early between approximately 14:10 and 14:30. This is due to the works progressing well and being completed ahead of schedule. Once these works are complete this will provide the customer with their desired outcome, as well as improve the reliability of the electricity network. Our reference number for this work is INCD-327312-U. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 21:19 - We're pleased to report that all power in the Brion Place area should now be restored. Our engineers have now safely connected temporary generator and this will be providing your power while our engineers work to fully repair the unexpected a faulty piece of underground equipment.

Depending on what the issue is, it may take a few days for our engineers to plan in the work and make their repairs, but once this is completed safely the generator can be removed, and network power will be resumed.

If you'd like any further information, or if your power is not restored, please call us any time on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 19:35 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that due to the time for the location and repairs required, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 22:00 and 23:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our team of specialist engineers have arrived on site to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Kevin at 10:50 - We can now confirm that all power in the Voltaire Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground network fault, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are still working to restore your power.

With the cold weather, we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating. If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on asap. Sent by Kevin at 09:41.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us work has been delayed due to lack of access to some of our equipment to carry out some tests.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 10:30 and 11:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Kevin at 07:26.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 03:17 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 2007 customers in the London SE23 area by diverting power around an underground cable fault. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 03:09 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the London SE23 area to investigate the power cut affecting 166 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Simon at 02:58.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 02:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 12:51 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so testing and repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 13:30 and 14:30 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for bearing with us over today.

Our specialist cable jointers have so far been unable to pinpoint the underground cabling fault, so they have instructed our digging gang to excavate our cabling. This will allow them to cut our cable, and using specialist equipment, test each side to help narrow down where the fault lies.

Our estimated time frame doesn't need to change currently, and we'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here on 08003163105 from any phone if you have any questions. Sent by Lisa at 11:23.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 11:24 - We can now confirm that all power in the Woolmongers Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Woolmongers Lane area, the estimated time of 14:00 and 15:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://UKPN.short.gy/fuse. Sent by Lisa at 10:46.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 10:34 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Woolmongers Lane area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 14:00 and 15:00, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

We are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Hi David here. I'm so sorry that power is still off this afternoon. I just wanted to let you know. Our engineers have just called in to advise us that they are still awaiting for the temporary generator to arrive on site in the Folkestone CT18 7 area and is now hindering our progress to restore power.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 17:00 and 18:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by David at 14:50.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 14:19 - Our staff have made more progress diverting power, so a further 13 homes and businesses now have their lights safely back on. We know there's still 61 properties affected by the power cut, and if your power is still off, don't worry - we'll continue to send you updates from our staff. We may send a few texts like this, so if your power has come back on now, or does at any point later on, just follow this link to stop our SMS updates https://UKPN.short.gy/STOP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so David, Adam, Luke and Theo are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 11:30. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing
